title: Awesome
comment: Awesome multiplied by infinity....using in conjunction with quodlibet on Linux arch...

title: Great client
comment: Streaming option is a deal breaker here along with clean and intuitive ui. Thank you  !

title: Almost perfect
comment: Just needs now playing to be reachable from  search results and some way to see artwork fullscreen

title: Awesome
comment: This is as good in many ways as a lot of mpd clients for the desktop. Actually, better than many of them. That's a tall order. I like it exactly as it is and wouldn't change a thing.

Exactly what I was looking for! However, no sort by Album Artist, but since it's open source I can probably just build that feature in there ;) Love the intuitive interface and beautiful material design!
Looks fantastic; works great

title: Awesome
comment: Just one wish: volume control system wide not just only while the app is opened. Then it would be perfect!

title: Wonderful but needs some work
comment: I am using this app to control my raspberry pi.  It the app works great but I find that when you switch to a new playlist shouldn't that flush the song qeue? A great feature that should be added is have the app be able to be controlled by the phone buttons for volume.  It would be cool if your able to have an experience like your playing media locally on your phone.

title: Locks up
comment: Locks up phone if it cannot connect to server. Only solution is a reboot. Bye bye.

title: Awesome app
comment: My first dive into MPD and this was the first mpd remote control I tried and I won't be bothering to look for another. Great work.

title: Great app. Does what it should.
comment: Would like the ability to cancel a connection attempt. Particularly if you put in an incorrect server. Had to stop the process from the application manager. It doesn't seem to time out. Also the order of the WIFI networks should be active/connected first.

title: Perfectly adequate
comment: It's a bit irksome that I have to enable the notification, then enable streaming, in that exact order, every time, in order to get streaming to work... but that's really a minor quibble. The rest of the app is way more than I could reasonably have hoped for.
Sorry for the trouble, the streaming feature should not work like that at all. We're working on huge connection improvements though!

title: Must have
comment: This app is the most epic one I've ever installed, the author is da real mvp, no ads in this app and it's totally free and works flawlessly!

title: Great
comment: Works great!

title: Great
comment: From a fellow dev: Would've given five stars it followed the Material Design guidelines more closely. Various icons (available for free from Google), sliders and navigation drawer.

Hello!
The Material "Redesign" that you're currently seeing has been worked on a lot, but hasn't landed on the play store yet.
I have no use for a navigation drawer though, so I got rid of it. The navigation simply works without one, and I will add it once I have enough to put in it.

title: Awesome just what I want.
comment: This is perfect except the volume is very low. Using on Nexus 5 stock. Did not have the same problem on LG Optimus G running Cyanogenmod, but had worse problems on that device. Steaming seems more stable and recoverable on Nexus 5.

title: Really nice!
comment: Only one thing missing: ability to add more connections if you need to control multiple MPD servers. Could you please add that?

title: Excellent.
comment: Works exactly as you expect it to.

title: Best mpd client for android.
comment: Gorgeous interface, solid back end, not too many settings thrown at you and best of all - it integrates wonderfully with Android Lollipop!

title: Perfect
comment: Best mpd client on Android.

title: Fantistic
comment: Even though the app doesn't play the stream(I think it supposed to my phone just isn't supported), I still gave it 5 stars, exactly what I was looking for simple and effective.

title: Great, but...
comment: Missing lock screen controls!

title: Pretty decent player
comment: Works on my Nexus 7 and on my HP pavilion chromebook (via archon packager and extension). Had to use landscape mode in order to access the now playing handle at screen bottom. In portrait mode they were off screen and inaccessible. The art work functionality is pretty flakey though. I have a lot of albums in a "Various artists" folder and none of them work with the art work loading methods being employed as a result apparently. Looks great on the ones that do work though. Maybe I will have to rework that folder into better shape to make more of the artwork accessible.
Thanks for your feedback. The next version will have better compatibility with all screen sizes and Archon.

title: Wonderful app
comment: This is the best Mopidy remote app I have tested. I'm running a mopidy server on my Raspberry Pi to control speakers in my kitchen. I love the notification control and lockscreen integration in Android 5.0.
Works great. Just wish it could handle  multiple servers  on one network.

title: Very nicely done
comment: The lack of a dedicated Search button is slightly cumbersome though.

title: Outstanding remote
comment: Finally got my mpd server up and running under Archlinux. I'm using Cantata (for the baked in stream support), and this tool on my moto-g 2nd gen just works...and "just works" is the best compliment of them all, imho. Put the ip address in, password and up it comes.  Thank you guys for the support, as well as a decent place to check bug reports and wishlist stuff. I WISH more developers were like this.  :-)  Happy Camper.

title: The best MPD client on mobile devices
comment: MPDroid is by far the best MPD client on mobile devices.  It's actually better than several full desktop clients I've tried.  It's easy to use, does a great job of displaying cover art (check the mpdroid wiki), lets you browse by folder structure or by tags and is all round very neat.  The only long term annoyance I've noticed compared to a desktop client like gmpc is it doesn't support the composer metadata field but anyway it does let you go to the album folder so if you have any kind of sensible tagging and naming scheme you can always get the info you need.  MPDroid improves with each release and MPD + MPDroid still has a place as a great way to enjoy your music collection, even in these days of DLNA/UPNP devices.

title: Mpd rocks
comment: The client is good!

title: Great NPD client
comment: Beautiful design, nice animations, material design. Open source. Works like a charm.

title: Beauty!
comment: Clean, stylisch and stable player! Using with Volumio on Raspberry Pi. Missing Spotify connect integration but that is more of an MPD protocol issue I think.

title: Love it.
comment: It's the best controller for mpd on the router.  Thanks a ton.
Works great with Mopidy Spotify

title: Great!
comment: Great design and implementation of an MPD client.

title: Wonderful MPD client.
comment: I use MPDroid to control my Raspberry Pi running music box, and it works nearly seamlessly. A beautiful UI I prefer using instead of the HTML interface built into the distro. My one complaint is that adding albums to the queue adds the songs in reverse order. A couple suggestions: change the UI so that switching from Artists to Albums to Songs works by swiping instead of a drop down menu, change the queue menu so that changing the queue is more gesture based instead of popup menu based.
Works good.

title: PLEASE FIX LATEST VERSION
comment: This latest version is terrible due to the sliding now playing tab for navigation between library and play que/now playing. It is terrible .when I want to scroll my que, I get the library, when I want the library I get the que.

title: Phenomenal
comment: Simply gorgeous! Using it like many others it seems to control a raspberry pi running mpd. Simple, good looking, open source, love it!   - update - still love it - couple of feature requests... 1) permanent now playing notification and widget.. 2) track numbers pls. Thanks

title: Brilliant app
comment: I have this on all of my Android devices (2 x Nexus 7's, Galaxy S4 and OnePlus One). Will make 5 stars if you can add options to not make the device sleep/lock when running and have multiple hosts. Thanks.

title: Remote, but can't stream
comment: Have not been able to successfully stream to android with this app. Running vlc on same android I could stream just fine.

title: No longer connects
comment: New version no longer connects using either my nexus 7 or galaxy tab.connections are correct and other clients work.pitty

title: Love it.
comment: This is a brilliant update of bugs and software for my MPD daemon. I thoroughly recommend it.

title: Great Update, but...
comment: Why did this (and other) updates just HAVE to wipe out the list of stream links? Other than that, I was quite pleased.

Hi ! This has been fixed in the beta. It's not available on the stable version yet, but please check out the 1.06 beta version, on the MPDroid beta testing community.
The beta version may crash a little more, and I'm sorry about that.
Works flawlessly
Perfect!

title: Best MPD Client!!
comment: This one does what it's supposed to do... great job namelessDev

title: Most useful app on Android
comment: Controls MPD nicely with just minor glitches. Would be nice if it can group compilations like theremin can do.
Awesome app

title: Yay Google
comment: Glad that google recognized the value of a great app and brought it back to the store.

title: Along with AMPD makes the best android music player
comment: Not yet perfect, but great at handling huge libraries

title: Wonderful
comment: New version is great. Streaming setup works wonders for me. Switching to current playing song may be not intuitive at first. I'd check the exit confirmation option by default
New interface  is amazing and useful,  thx alot

title: This is a great app.
comment: Works great with my MPD install.
It gets better and better with every new version.

title: Yes!
comment: I love this app. I would love it more if switching between hosts was easier.

title: Rap home world Girls class
comment: Rich kidzz da

title: Great app!
comment: I used it for years now and I can't imagine how I could play my music without it! Please don't give up on this one, NamelessDev! BTW - last update is cool, although I was used to the side menu. I guess I'll get used to the swipe up/down modes quickly :) EDIT: THANK YOU for staying with us! Keep up the great work!

title: Worth paying for
comment: Light weight and solid

title: Thanks but it's step backwards
comment: Had great and easy to use UI, but now most features are hard to reach because they are context dependant. There is no option to start in "now playing" mode and there is no access to the main menu from there. Streaming is broken with some (current) MPD versions. Having a notification is a great idea, but the close button should close the client instead of disabling the notification itself. Volume button(s) on it would be handy too. It's not possible to search the library by file/folder name.

title: Great
comment: makes using music at home a breeze.

title: Genius
comment: Works great, simple, pithy, succinct

title: This app is awesome!
comment: And then some!!! I use this everyday with my Pi MusicBox build. Works like a charm.
Best android MPD client

title: Best MPD Client
comment: By far the best MPD Client on the play store.

title: Best app ever. Latest release has bug for me.
comment: Google please don't shut this down.   Please.   The bug is: I can't (add remove and play)  when there are files in the active play list.   Can't add either from play lists or files.  Using Sony z3v 4.4.4 and an old mpd (2 years ago stable)

title: Mpd + MPDroid = pure music bliss
comment: Thank you for this wonderful app. Best interface for my home mpd/music server. Great work namelessDev!

title: Awesome program... Let is stay!
comment: Google. Seriously. Please let this app remain. It's open source for crying out loud!

title: Remarkable!
comment: Best android remote for Bryston BDP music players. Fast, stable and beautiful. I sure hope Google doesn't pull it as threatened.

title: Awesome app! Keep it on PlayStore!
comment: I usually don't give reviews, but I feel it's necessary now. @dev: I love this app! It makes controlling my MPD-setup feel so natural and easy. I found no other app that can do it better, and I searched for clients on Win, GNU/Linux, iOS & Android. @Google: Didn't you always say "Don't be evil"? What would you call removing an open source app that so many people love from the play store (honest question)? It certainly did not infringe anything. At least tell the dev and don't refuse to talk.

title: Everyday use
comment: I use this app everyday. I went through a few before finding this one. Is rather not give it up.

title: Best MPD client out there. One request though...
comment: This is the best MPD client for Android, very responsive and straight forward. I'm using it to control my Pi MusicBox. I hope it will stay in the Play store. One request to the developer though: could you please make the default action when clicking on a song  configurable? The default action adds the song to the playlist but I would like to set it to 'replace and start playing'. - - Edit: thanks for replying namelessDev, simple mode seems to be the answer :)
Try "simple mode" in the settings, it is maybe what you are looking for :)

title: The best MPD-client I have used!
comment: This has evolved into a really great app. I use it with Mopidy music server with the Spotify module running on my Raspberry Pi. Would be truly sad if it got pulled because of some copyright troll.

title: Great app
comment: This works great, have used it for ages and is perfect with my setup. Hope that Google reevaluates their decision.

title: Best MPD client for Android
comment: Smooth, clean, lightweight and no ads.

title: Great mpd app!
comment: This is the most usable mpd app that I've found on android. Nice work!

title: The best in the business.
comment: This is the best MPD app you can get, no question. Please God don't take it down.

title: Awesome app
comment: Too bad google is a douchenozzle for banning it from the play store. You suck googleplaystorebots.

title: Simply the best mpd app
comment: Google should at least tell *us* what the infringement is.

title: Sad to see it go.
comment: I feel like google just alienated one of its babies. this is a gem. :(

title: Another voice hoping Google does not remove this app.
comment: The best Android Client for MPD around. Works well to control MPD running on a Raspberry Pi. Not much more I can say, a 5 star free and open source app to control a free and open source music server.  How can there be any copyright infringement?.

title: Great mpd client!
comment: Seriously Google! Pulling an app from Play Store and not telling the developer why makes me want to stop developing for the Android platform. Developers deserve to know what they are accused for and a list of "possible" reasons simply isn't good enough. How can you fix something if you don't know what it is? Many thanks to the author for a great app.

title: By far the best MPD client for Android
comment: I use this to remote-control my PC that plays music.  I just wish it used the "Media Volume" feature in Android, so I could adjust the volume without having to unlock my phone and open the app.

title: Great app
comment: 5 star app. Thanks to all devs for nice work!

title: What  the hell Google.
comment: Stop being so "Apple" this doesn't infringe anything.

title: I love this app!
comment: Google, you doing something wrong - it's free open source control program to another free open source program, why you remove it from Store? This is the best app to remote control mpd!

title: The best MPD remote app for Android
comment: Is there a way to appeal again? Perhaps on Google Play's Google+ page?

title: Fantastic application
comment: Just read that Google will be removing this app for copyright infringement. It can't be explained. This is just a client with no content of its own. Why remove it...

title: Perfect app!
comment: It does everything it need to do, in a very nice interface.   keep up the good work, I hope any play store issues can get fixed!

title: The best.
comment: There are no better MPD controllers. The latest update elevates it to a whole new level.

title: Best mpd app
comment: I am really shocked to read that this app shall be removed from playstore. #WTF

title: Best mpd app
comment: I love mpdroid, best mpd app by far. I use it daily and would be very unhappy if it was removed from the play store. There's a lot of junk there, this is excellent free software. Thanks so much for making the effort!

title: Awesome
comment: Simply the best so out there and is installed on 3 devices of mine. Works very well with Rune Audio on my raspberry pi.

title: Copyright?
comment: Can't believe Google is pulling this app from Google Play. It makes no sense to me that they won't let the author appeal their decision. I truly hope this gets resolved, this is a great app.

title: Regarding copyright..
comment: Most probably it's about some screenshot with an artist name/picture. Remove those screenshots, explain the situation and ask for appeal.
Hello ! Screenshots have already been replaced by free music found on Jamendo. I already appealed, explained that the cover is free, and it got denied.
Thanks
New version works great. Not sure what copyrights are infringed but i hope that's a misunderstanding.
One of the best client

title: Fantastic app, hope it stays
comment: I use this app every day and it beats all the other clients out there. Really hoping it doesn't get taken down, it's a shame when a well written open source app like this gets attacked and things like Talking Tom reign the charts (hope I didn't infringe on copyright there. SORRY GOOGLE)

title: Boo Google
comment: Great app. Thanks!

title: Very Good with one annoyance
comment: Attractive, intuitive,  advanced settings. Works very well. The only con I see is the keyboard popping up every time you go to the "now playing" screen. This is a major annoyance because I must hit "back" to get the keyboard to collapse after I queue an album. Stock Tab2 7. Smaller screen devices don't have this problem because a compact UI is used. Edit: Next version fixed the keyboard issue.
Sorry, this has been fixed in the beta versions. Please look at the "MPDroid Beta testing" community on Google+ if you are interested.

title: Great MPD Client!
comment: I like the new enhancements, great job!
Fantastic MPD Client

title: Great app
comment: The best MPD client in the market. I really like the 'play next' option and the album arts in the playlist. I'd like to see more widgets (perhaps something with volume control), not that the current widgets are bad.

title: The best of the best android mpd client so far
comment: The latest update is shocking me!  Thanks for the great work!   And  If it could sort the play queue, then you put me in heaven!    Last but not least, I hope dev can tell us how to help you to appeal.

title: Great
comment: Best mpd client ever used!

title: It's open source!
comment: The latest update is terrific!

title: Best
comment: Thenks to developers!

title: Nothing infringes here!
comment: Recently the users of this app were notified that this app would be pulled due to copyright infringement. This is a simple remote control app? Not a player/downloader/whatever. This is literally the best MPD client for a mobile device. Period.  Please Google folks, let namelessDev address any issues so this wonderful app can stay. I assume this is just the beginning of some automated process and this will be cleared up.

title: Very good
comment: Was using BitMPC for 5 years, but this one much better.

title: works for me samsung s3
comment: The app works like a charm.....only two small tweaks and it will be perfect....if the developer could fix the issue when you skip to the next song from the main page while streaming remote or local it would start to buffer right away until 10 seconds after the next song finish buffering......when you skip a song it should play all the way up to the point you skip so there wont be a gap in the song..... also if you try to restart a song from the beginning it would skip to the previous song, other than that it works fine.

title: Good
comment: Its possible to play a automatic song at 6 oclock like a waker? Sorry for my english

title: excellent
comment: beautiful as well as useful/
Does what it says on the box and does it well. Good ap. Keep it that way pls dont ruin it with crap updates no one wanted or asked for like everytbing else on the play store.

title: Tried them all. This is the best.
comment: I tried about a dozen different MPD clients, and this is the best MPD client for Android, period. Can browse by Artist, Album, or File System (which was the most important feature for me). Looks pretty, too, and works just fine. Thank you!

title: Works very well but it could be better.
comment: It works very well to control my server but I dislike that I have to tap several times to return to the "Now playing" screen while navigating the app, a short cut in a corner of the sreen, always visible, would be nice. Also a short cut or widget in the lock screen and/or the task bar of the phone will make a huge difference in usability.

title: No complaints whatsoever
comment: It does one thing, and does it extremely well. Has all common controls that an mpd client is supposed to have. As easy to set up as any other client.
Awesome
Very smooth .

title: Works great as a mpd controller
comment: This app is excellent as an mpd controller. I haven't had much luck yet with streaming yet but that could be my configuration. Still, the app doesn't return any useful errors and will just keep trying to connect or shut off the streaming option without warning.

title: Simple and easy
comment: Awesome app for MPD. Love the artwork feature.

title: Almost Perfect
comment: I would like to see a stop button on the widget.  Edit:good job let's see some tasker integration :)

Tasker integration (unstable) has been released in 1.07 Beta 2.  
I insist on "unstable" :)

title: All my stars
comment: I've been using it over a year now. I have streamed music hundreds of miles over the internet using it in conjunction with SSH tunnelling. I lie in bed reading on my tablet and use it to change the music. I loved MPD before I started using this app, but now my life is complete. This app turns both my phone and tablet into remote controls for my music. It is indispensable. This new release makes it even better; it's as if the developer(s) read my mind and put effort into making it faster and easier to use. N

title: Volume resets to 0, streaming disabled
comment: When selecting another song to play, the streaming option is disabled and volume is reset back to 0 on Huawei G700 (Android 4.2.1)  Looking into this.

title: Simply superb!
comment: I run my mpd from home NAS server, which is accessible from both Android and windows phone. Nice experience!

title: Best of its kind.
comment: I've tried all existing android MPD clients, and this one beats them all hands down. Lots of settings, lots of features, actually good design and usable ui.

title: Streaming rocks!
comment: It all works smoothly and the streaming feature it's just brilliant! (though it mixes up tracks visualisation sometimes)

title: Awesome UI
comment: This app has very easy to use UI and have many feature.

title: It's good
comment: This is a great MPD frontend.

title: Neat
comment: It has a few quirks, but overall I'm impressed. It's certainly better than the majority of MPD clients I've tried.

title: Excellent
comment: Works great, looks great. Tablets are supported, what else do you need.

title: Great
comment: The best mpd client I've used
So great with mpd at raspberry

title: Streaming is troublesome
comment: Streaming will randomly stop when I hit my devices back button. The check box becomes unchecked as well, without user interaction.  If a streaming song is buffering, the song will continue to play. This leads to missing 10-30 seconds of a song while waiting for it to buffer. Could there be an option to automatically pause the current song while it buffers?  Overall this is the best android mpd client by far. It is very polished, and works consistently in most areas. Please address the streaming problems!
Does the job. What more is to be said?

title: The best MPD client for Android
comment: Works well, great UI. Only thing I miss is the ability to easily switch between several instances of mpd running in the same network.

title: Bugs are back
comment: Adding an album like "Greatest Hits" or "Live" adds all albums with that title, not just the one by the selected artist.

title: Support for multiple servers
comment: This is a fantastic app. I have built a "poor man's" sonos solution for my house with four zones using Raspberry PI. The only addition that i wuold like to see is the ability to select from a list of servers. I.E. I have 4  RPIs around the house and would like to select the zone i am in to play. I currently use MP Remote for the simple fact that is has the ability to select from multiple servers. If MPDroid had this feature, it would hands down the best app for MPD control.  Thanks..... Awesome job

title: Seems Buggy
comment: Often displays errors like connection failed, for no reason. Actions randomly fail. Nice ui design though.
I would love to have some kind of sleep timer because I really take advantage of the streaming feature. But otherwise it's just perfect!
Confusing UI, misdetecting connection every time screen goes on.

title: Awesome, and free
comment: What a great way to listen to your whole library. My library is so large that MPD is the only way to navigate it. And with the easy scrolling of this app its a perfect front end for my galaxy s 3. Thank you namelessdev, I hope it keeps getting better with time!

title: Nice, but not perfect
comment: I'm used to play music on my squeezebox with the app squeeze commander. Recently made the switch to mpd. I like it a lot. But the client's for android are not very good (compared to squeeze commander).   I miss the random function on songs/genre/year the most. For me that would be a high priority addition for mpdroid

title: Actually life changing!
comment: I listen to twice as much music since getting this. Easily the best MPD remote out there! Find some old hardware to run the server on, jam it in the corner of the room and you can't lose. Excellent, rock solid, easy to use music system.

title: Better Artist/Song grouping would make it 5*
comment: I'd vote this 5* if it did the following in Artists view. 1# could show all songs by artist instead of having to choose an album. 2# grouping of artist could ignore capital letters e.g. 'Arcade fire' and 'Arcade Fire' together instead of separate entries.

title: Interface is not so intuitive but it is very functional and appealing app
comment: A tutorial upon launch could reduce the learning curve in using this app. Nonetheless I can now listen to my MP3 collection located in my server from any device at home or away from it.  This app is great for mobiles/tablets. It would be great to have the functionality to download the lyrics.

title: Works perfectly for my headless Raspberry
comment: I am happy with this app. Plain and simple and does what its supposed to without hassles

title: problem
comment: how can i put the last song in middle of playlist?

title: Best MPD client out there!
comment: Works amazingly as a remote or streaming client, and if won't make your eyes bleed.

title: Top!
comment: Love this, especially the phone integration (MPD pauses as the phone rings).

title: Best mpd client
comment: Does almost everything that you'd expect from an mpd client.

title: Perfect mpd client
comment: Looks good to. Automatic album art.

title: Great MPD player
comment: Finally a great MPD client for Android!  Thank you!

title: UI is unintuitive but still the best MPD client on Google Play
comment: The last updates made the UI really whack in my opinion. You swipe left, and then right, and don't return to where you came from. Also the back button is inconsistent, sometimes it steps back like expected, sometimes it quits the whole app. That being said, thanks for making this great app! It works great with Mopidy and best of all its free!

title: Great with Volumio on RPi
comment: Better than the standard Volumio web interface. Finally got FLAC audio wireless streaming to amp using Volumio on Raspberry Pi controlled via MPDroid on Android. Awesome, thanks.

Feature request: update of not complete database, but only in selected folder path (GIMPC windows client has it, mpc linux client has option "update "). That is very important if you add new music and want see it in the list instantly. Update of complete database with thousands of songs on small ARM servers takes hours. Otherwise superb app!

title: Perfect
comment: Nice work, Nice design. one thing, I can not control volume. Is this UI volume for streaming? > UI volume works!   audio_output {              type          "alsa"      name          "foo ALSA Device"   mixer_type    "software"   tags    "yes"           replay_gain_handler  "software"   }   Perfect. Thanks
No, the ui should control the output volume, unless you have a MPD configuration problem

title: Works great
comment: This app has seen a lot of improvement recently. The interference is smooth and intuitive and controls my mpd server with no lag. The problem with dropped connections also seems to have been fixed. Great little app, plus it's free and open source.

Very few crashes. Excellent UI. We use this to control our MPD server at our hip coffee shop. Works great even with big playlists. Buttery smooth on my Nexus 4 and 5. Would be perfect if it had profiles support to pick the small custom MPD servers I have in different rooms at home. Keep up the good work!

title: Great App
comment: Would be nice to be able to have to display your mpd collection e.g. via album, or via Files by default.

title: Great!
comment: Exactly what I was looking for, even built-in support for streaming! Can't seem to run the app in the background though, the streaming stops then?

title: Looks great
comment: Tried this app to connect to music box for raspberry pi (linked to Spotify) as I wasn't to keen on their web interface. It works pretty well but it won't load songs lists for any album. It can play any of my predefined playlists though. If it could do this it would definitely be 5 star. Good work looks great.
Is music box running their own mpd daemon or are they running mopidy ? Don't hesitate to email me about this, I'm interested in more testing :)

title: Simple & very useful app.
comment: I use this app to control minidnlna running on RasberryPi, which inturn is hooked upto a Denon receiver. Listening to music is just a breeze with Mpdroid on my S2. Cheers developers !!!

title: No way to select MPD server
comment: Short of changing server IP every time, I found no way of switching which server to control. Annoying to say the least. I've also been unable to get any album art or even list albums in any other format than a list of lines. Also seems to default to Artist listing every time I go to Library. Please remember both previous library view and position!

Hello ! The multi server is coming in a future release. For the default library list and order, please look into the preferences, there is a way to order them (so you can make something else the default) and even hide the ones you don't need.

title: Streaming - Solved
comment: Streaming settings must be set to lame. Streaming works fine now.

Have you checked that your streaming configuration is alright ? The streaming code lacks good error handling, so it can slow down your phone pretty badly if the configuration is bad, but not otherwise.

title: Excellent
comment: The best mpd client!

title: Choice
comment: Excellent update! More logical menu action!

title: Playing :)
comment: Great application!
Send me an email, I'll help you with the streaming :)

title: Works well, with one regression
comment: This is far and away my favourite android mpd client - easy to find and play songs, good stream management. I can live with the new style side menu too. However, streams no longer play when they're specified as urls to .m3u or .pls files, which worked flawlessly in the previous version. Hopefully there's an easy fix...?
Thanks for the report. you can follow this bug's progress here : https://github.com/abarisain/dmix/issues/377

title: Great
comment: By far the best Android MPD client.

title: Great app
comment: Using with raspberry pi. I hv a small feature request. Can you make playlist sort alphabetically? Thanks

title: Great MPD client
comment: This app is as good as computer based MPD clients such as gmpc.

title: Perfect
comment: Even better with the new ui improvements

title: Perfect!
comment: Customizable, lean and... just work! Thank you
Good app

title: Awesome!!
comment: I have MPD installed on a Raspberry Pi, and it's connected to a stereo in my garage, and with this app, summer parties and bonfires have my entire music library at the control of my phone. People are always so amazed! :)

title: Perfect
comment: The revised navigation is the icing on the cake. 5 stars!!

title: Very nice!
comment: Just what i need for my raspberry pi.

title: Werkt perfect!
comment: Werkt perfect samen met de mpd server op mijn router :-) Erg overzichtelijk en mooi uiterlijk met de album art.
Works pretty well
Very good mpd client in android
Excellent

title: Awesome
comment: Easy to use and configure. One of my favorite apps.

title: It works
comment: Great and stable SW. Wish to have indication if database creation is ongoing.

title: Best mpd android remote.
comment: Best mpd android remote. Good work!

title: Excellent
comment: Does exactly as advertised, no hard set up and best of all no defaultly applied bright theme.

title: Very good!
comment: If the interface of this were as nice as Google's Play Music that would be awesome, but its pretty close and it works flawlessly. Thanks!

title: Looks good and easy to use
comment: It took a lot of time for me to set up MPD on raspberry pi, but now it works great.  Extending it to being able to streaming podcasts would make it even better.

title: Top class
comment: Great app - and made even better by it being free, ad-free and open source.  The only feature I'd like is a "random" button that would selecy and play a random album from your collection.  Congratulations on a great app.

title: Best out there but
comment: the navigation is awful. Most of the time I use folder navigation and sometimes going 5 folders deep in order to cue songs. I hate the fact that if I go back to the player my previous location is not remembered.   Other than that I have nothing else to complain about. The UI is beautiful. A lot prettier than any other music player for android.  I was a previous user of mpod for ios but I must say mpdroid is much faster and more responsive than mpod ever was.

title: Playlists
comment: Useless until you can load and play a playlist stored on the server.

title: Close to the perfection
comment: the only thing that this app miss is the possibility ti load playlist and  cuesheet in mpd.

title: Five Stars
comment: Mpdroid is a truly awesome app.  Deserves 10 stars.

title: Overall good.
comment: The only criticism: my MPDroid crashes when I try to "Play next" song. Nexus 7 (first generation).

title: Improvements are excellent
comment: I have preferred droid mpd client over this app for some time. Tried this out again and the improvements have made this app better. Simple things like scrolling through a long playlist is faster using the edge 'fast' scroll and the ability to enter a search term and have the results grouped under artists, albums and songs that contain the search term.

title: Excellent!!
comment: Great app! Works perfectly! Can't really think of any way to improve it! Congrats!

title: A great app!
comment: It works as expected; but a little bit more improvement can be done in the initial server setup phase. The navigation seems a bit confusing at that phase.
Would love to see a notification widget.

title: A roller coaster ride
comment: This app is great! Well, parts of it are anyways. The interface looks amazing and it's responsive. The problem is that it locks up out of the blue. It never locks up while I'm doing the same thing and when it locks up, it locks the whole phone up. Hopefully this kink gets worked out soon because I am unable to use the software because of it. Compared to the other options, this is one of the best looking clients.

title: Excelent
comment: Been faffing with rygel and xbmc and wrong tools today to setup a headless music server.  If I'd have known there was a top quality mpd client for Android earlier I'd have saved my self a lot of hassle.  Quality APP, looks good too, big five stars from me.

title: Nice app, love the artist images
comment: Use this to control my Raspberry Pi. Xbian/XBMC handles the video, and this handles headless MPD. Only problem is when used on a Samsung Galaxy the keyboard pops up all the time, minor bug I guess?

title: Awesome.
comment: I love this app. I especially love that you can stream to it if you use the httpd output in mpd. I wish there was a way to set it to streaming by default on my tablet, but I understand why you wouldn't want that on a phone. still, a toggle that was disabled by default would be nice, especially because without it, it kind of defeats the purpose of the widget. to get my mpd server to stream properly, I commented out the 'bind_to_host' setting because I use ufw to control network access anyway. also, I had to use the 'lame' encoder because for whatever reason 'vorbis' would cause MPDroid to freeze. otherwise, I love this app. Update: I love the notification controls in the newer versions (hint: hide your other notifications if you can't see them). This was a feature that was missing for me until a while ago when they magically appeared after an auto-update ;)

title: Amazing app, works great. Multi Server please!
comment: This is a fantastic app, I have a few mpd servers running on Pi's and this app is invaluable and a pleasure to use. What would be great is being able to store the details of more than one mpd server so i could chose them and navigate between them.

title: Best mpd app for android
comment: Does almost everything you could want, and does it quite well.  The only feature I think is missing is the ability to add songs from the library using a "play next" or "play now"  feature to add songs after the currently playing song.

title: Disappointed
comment: Have been a fan of MPDroid for years, especially the builtin streaming capability. This doesn't seem to be supported (at least, not over 3/4G) for use on my new HTC One 4G LTE.  Hopefully the developer will fix this in the future.

Hello ! I've had multiple reports of 3/4G streaming not working on the HTC One. I still don't know what is happening, but I suspect HTC broke something since it works on other devices. In the meantime, please try some streaming app like TuneIn Radio, which is known to work well with MPD, and use MPDroid as a controller.

title: Outstanding
comment: Nice ux, works great. Must have if you need an MPD client. Many thanks to the dev!
Very handy, nice new design

title: Great App
comment: Works great.  Have it on my nexus 4 & 7 and it does a great job in both screen sizes.  Great job, great implementation!  This was exactly what I needed for my Raspberry Pi mpd server.

title: Limited
comment: To just one server. Could get 4 stars if it had support for multiple MPD servers.

title: it's awesome
comment: The best MPD client of ever.. it have all what I need and many features also

title: Great start
comment: By far the best MPD client on Android. Looks great however the navigation isn't always 100% clear and could be simplified. Crashes occasionally but is awesome otherwise!

title: Superb
comment: Beautiful interface, fast, the occasional crash but it only takes a second to restart when that happens. Highly recommended.

title: If only it didn't crash
comment: It crashes nearly every time I return to it from a different app, which is quite often. I'm on a non rooted phone too. It's a shame because the interface is generally good although one gripe is the inability to add a playlist to the queue once you view its contents. You have to go back which returns to the top, forcing you to re-find the one you want.

title: Stunning
comment: Last update brought massive improvements to an already impressive app. Completely outpaces the competition in form AND function.

title: Very good!
comment: Great app for controlling your MPD-Server. I could only wish for one more feature. I have 2 mpd servers, en the only way to control both of them is by changing accespoint or change settings. Could there be a better option for that?  Exept that little "problem", this app is by far the best app for MPD on Android!

title: perfect
comment: does all I could wish for in a mpd client. Only thing missing is playlist management. (add/remove songs to/from custom playlist files)

title: Highly recommend
comment: Awesome app..  Genius..  Thank you.

title: Close to perfect
comment: This client is stunning and beautiful. I haven't been impressed by an app that much for a long time.  What I'm missing (or overlooking) is a notification for monitoring what's playing in the background without streaming. And also a bit improved widget that shows track information as well as an album cover.  Besides this, the app is perfect for me.

title: Fantastic App
comment: great design, great execution. All in all, a fantastic app.

title: Must have for MPD users
comment: Feature suggestion: how about option to pause playback when a call is received and resume playing when it's finished?  I know this can hardly be considered as core function but I'd be nice combined with the living room stereo.
This feature is already available in the settings.

title: Excellent app
comment: Just one request. Can you make the songs that are already in playlist marked in the filelist?

title: Great update!
comment: This app is even better now. Listing by album artist has been fixed. Cover art downloads quicker. By far the best mpd  frontend.

title: Awesome!
comment: Always been a fan :)

title: Awesome
comment: The new update made it even better.

title: Fantastic app.
comment: Use it all the time, couldn't ask for anything else, last couple of updates fixed all the issues. Very stable. Absolutely brilliant!!

title: Neat UI
comment: The user interface looks really really neat (much like Google Music) and is easy to use. The widget is especially useful.

title: Great MPD Frontend
comment: Great UI and functionality. A very useful app indeed.

title: Great!
comment: The only problem is there is no way to set timeout on connecting mpd. But after all its best android mpd client IMHO

title: Nearly perfect
comment: Only thing missing for me would be prev/next/stop/pause buttons in the notification area

title: Best MPD UI
comment: You app has the best user interface of any MPD client I've used. Thanks!

title: Brilliant
comment: Excellent application. Need a slightly more interesting UI though.  Thank you very much for this though.

title: Incredible App!
comment: Firstly I'd like to say thank you so much for creating such an incredibly fully featured application, I use it on a daily basis and love it.  There is one thing I feel that it is missing though, and that would be the ability to use the android media controls (I.e. from the lock screen / notifications area) to control the current connected server. Is this something that you would consider implementing?
Awesome

title: Great app
comment: One of the only mpd clients that works well with mopidy. Great app!

title: Super app
comment: Works like you'd expect it to. Nicely done!

title: Excellent, useful tool.
comment: Apart from a few crashes, it works like a charm. Fine tool for anyone using MPD.

title: Last couple of updates improved stability
comment: I can now see my whole library and longer playlists work properly, making it a very nice app. Excellent :)

title: Good
comment: Use this with raspberry pi!!! It rules!

title: No fuzz great client
comment: Tried many other clients this one is the best. Nice usability, all features. Good work, thanks!

title: Fantastic!
comment: This app is exactly doing what I wanted. Smooth and , y elegant UI. I recommend it to all.

title: MPDroid + RaspberryPi + MPD
comment: I have setup my raspberryPi with MPD running. The Pi is connected via lan cable to my hub. My Pi is connected to a wireless speaker.  My GalaxySiii is connected to the lot via this excellent app! I can see my playlists and my tracks and search for new stuff.  I love it! Thank you!

title: multiple servers
comment: please support multiple control servers. e.g. server profiles

title: Wonderful
comment: The new interface is great, overall I love the thing. The only feature I miss is a support for multiple server profiles - I have two MPD servers at home and switching between them by editing the IP address is a pain.

title: Very good mpd client
comment: Great app, works like a charm ( i have mpd runnin on my raspberry pi ). The programmer has had lots of love for the details, which i appreciate very much. Overall usability and comfort very high

title: Great app.
comment: I love this app. It has nice UI, it's stable and works like a charm.

title: Perfect
comment: This app is by far the best MPD client for Android in my oppinion. It has a very intuitive interface and is amazingly redponsive with my large library. Very nice!

title: Works with a few issues
comment: I'm on Android 4.2 and as the dev states if you don't use the wlan profiles.  Streaming does work, with some lag.  The song will start but it can take a few seconds up to 15 seconds before I hear anything.    I've also noticed that sometimes play back will randomly stop, skip to the next song and remove the previous song from the playlist.  Not sure what's going on there.  Otherwise, it works well and I will upgrade my rating to 5 when the those issues are fixed.

title: Fantastic MPD Controller
comment: I have a sophisticated multicast setup that uses mpd to stream concurrent audio to multiple locations. This app allows me too control it with ease. It's well polished, has great functionality, and is quick.

title: Wow
comment: Almost perfect. Even ipv6 works. Would be useful to have options to swe lirycs lukę i.e. sonata. Also why mpdroid establishes two TCP connections to mpd server? One should be enough. Waiting for 4.2 fixes for Wi-Fi .

title: Puts the others to shame
comment: Easily the most polished and hassle free Android MPD client

title: Dear gods yes!
comment: I was going to write an app for this purpose, but lo and behold, it had already been done for me.  Much love and many thanks.

title: Outstanding work!
comment: I was worried development on mpd and clients was falling by the wayside.  Not so!  Thanks, man!

title: Awesome!
comment: Thank you!

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome open source application. Glad I found it. Thanks, developers.

title: Perfect app
comment: With the last update big UX improvement comes. I really like it now!

title: does not work on android 4.2.1
comment: After update to android>=4.2 app stopped working (instead of defined mpd server, it is connecting to localhost), which is pitty, because it is by far the best mpd client ever. Before upgrade on my nexus7 it worked as a charm and was really nice!

title: Just exactly right
comment: Everything you could ask for in an MPD client. Better than many desktop MPD clients. Better than most standalone music players for Android. If only more software were this good. Nice work!
Best Android mpd client I've used.

title: Great!
comment: The new redesign is excellent. Thank you for such a great app!

title: Perfect
comment: Exelent interface and just do the job, great!

title: Best android MPD client ever !
comment: Interface is great ! Functionalities awesome ! You should write in description this is opensource software ! :-)

comment: No longer works with jelly bean 4.2 update.

title: Good app
comment: Good app, works really great.  A plus would be support for multiple mpd servers per WiFi network

title: Broken on 4.2
comment: Doesn't seem to work on JB 4.2 on my Nexus 7, but works on my Desire Z running 4.0. Seems to be an issue with name lookup returning localhost instead of the host IP entered.

title: Great feature set.
comment: I was just looking for a way to control my mpd stream but then I saw that the app can connect to the stream as well, bloody awesome.

title: Great app!
comment: The best Android mpd client by miles.
Best MPD controller for android.

title: Wonderful MPD Client!
comment: This is easily the best MPD client on the Android Market. Super-easy to configure, streaming is a breeze (although it takes a few seconds to buffer, usually about 8 for me, no fault of the app though). And using it as a remote when I'm home is great! The last update with the UI re-design has made this an amazing app! Keep up the great work namelessDev!

title: Top notch
comment: Best mpd client ever. The only problem I've had so far is when I try to adjust the volume, it switches to the current playlist. If only I could disable that switch behavior...

title: Fantastic App
comment: Very stable. The new interface is both intutive and smooth. I wish more apps were this good :)  I actually successfully used it (including streaming) over OpenVPN!

title: Best android mpd frontend.
comment: Good interface, lots of features and works like a charm!

title: Slick
comment: Really nice app, very slick and intuitive.

title: Awesome MPD client!
comment: This works very well.  Streaming is working for me using lame.  Vorbis streaming also works, but has a longer lag time for some reason.   I'm not sure if that's related to the server, device, or this software.   It works very well for controlling mpd.  Streaming is just a bonus.  :)
Excellent remote client

title: Amazing MPD Client
comment: Thanks for such a fantastic product!  I was doing some yard work and streaming music to my AV receiver and my phone at the same time.

title: 5 stars!
comment: For the new slick interface.

title: Very Nice!
comment: After the recent UI redesign, this app has become my primary MPD client on both my phone and my tablet. The tablet UI could still use some improvements, such as larger buttons, less wasted space, etc., but overall it is really nice. My favorite feature is still the WLAN-based configuration, since I have an MPD server at home and at work.

title: Awesome remote control for MPD
comment: Nicely intuitive interface, easily set up. I'm impressed!

title: Playlist support a step backwards...
comment: Why are the play lists not in alphabetical order any more? That one change makes this useless for me.

title: Finally
comment: I've had android phones since you could have android phones. And this is the first actually good MPD client yet. Kudos to the dev, it works fast and well, and looks great doing it.

title: Great application!
comment: This app is getting better and better. Works like a charm on Galaxy Nexus, Nexus 7 and even on the Cruz e-reader.

title: Best MPD client on Android
comment: Best feature set. Regular updates.

title: Awesome!
comment: Great app. Thank you! !

title: Works great
comment: Great MPD remote client.

title: Excellent app
comment: Works well and looks great, especially after the last update. The only thing I would like to see is the ability to add a number of random songs to the now playing list, a library shuffle of sorts

title: Works fine!
comment: A bit of a hack to configure for amateurs. But works nice once setup. Just change bind_to_address setting in mpd conf file from "localhost" to "0.0.0.0"
Flawless app!

title: thanks
comment: ...works! til the last update i missed the local cover feature, now i dont miss anything anymore...

title: Perfect
comment: This is really great work thank you! This latest version is music to my eyes!

title: Excellent new version
comment: New version is much more usable and works fine on JB. Thanks!

title: Awesome
comment: Works a treat, and super fast response when there are issues. Thanks!

title: Super
comment: Excellent update.  Cover art works like a charm again. Runs smoothly on my Nexus 7. :-)

title: Loving the new update
comment: Cheers, I had almost lost hope for this application but good job on the update!

title: Awesome
comment: Awesome update! Now its look nice and still work well. TY for update and bug fixing.

title: Beautiful Update
comment: Thanks for the beautiful update. Its a major revision and bugs are to be expected. We appreciate your hard work and talent. How can I buy you a beer? :-)

title: awesome
comment: Loving this app for quite some time and now it even got better. Perfect!

title: The best MPD remote for phones
comment: This app is the best MPD remote for Android. The only reason it gets four stars instead of five is there is no easy way to save multiple server profiles for the same WLAN.

title: Great.
comment: I use this to control my VortexBox.

title: Very nice & usefull app
comment: Thank you, new version quite cool too

title: Just perfect!
comment: I like the new style. Its perfect to manage the playlist from my phone!

title: Great App
comment: This is just what I needed. Now I can control the mpd server in the house from anywhere. Even plug headphones into the droid and stream to it. A few bugs still, but the developer is very responsive and fixes them quickly. Thanks!!

title: Awesome update
comment: The old MPDroid was ok. Not really great but it was doing it's job good enough. The new version's interface is really well thought. My only issue is the double back needed to close it but that's it.

title: Best MPD client...
comment: ...however, the latest version is unusable on my HTC Flyer, Android 3.2.1, as it crashes every time I open the library view. Until this is fixed, I will have to look elsewhere. :-(

title: Holy Update Batman
comment: This application has been quite useful for a long time and with the latest update it also looks absolutely gorgeous.

title: Works great and Libre/Open source
comment: Thanks, dev for a terrific mpd client and for providing the source! First app I'd give six stars to. Thx to pmix devs also!

comment: I like the new interface quite a bit! Thanks for making this one of my favorite music apps  :-)

title: GREAT!!!

comment: A brilliant application for a great media server.  Ridiculously simple and fast, and now it looks great, too - everything I need it to be. Thank you.

title: I laughed, I cried, it changed my life

Excellent - the latest update is a big UI improvement!  Easily my favorite MPD client on Android.

title: Nice
comment: So much nicer than the previous version! Thanks ;)

title: Brilliant app
comment: The latest release is great but the volume slider is too fiddly and starts a swipe to the next screen if slightly off target. Would give 5 stars otherwise.

title: Awesome
comment: Two things: 1)add sorting by genre? 2)if streaming is active the phone's volume keys should affect the phones volume and not the server's.

title: Good
comment: Was mediocre before latest update, now it's the best. Well done developer. EDIT: Need to make the handles on the seek and volume controls larger, it's difficult to hit them.

title: Totally works
comment: Everything works, best version ever. There's even a short cut menu for output speakers. Streaming works wonderfully. Thanks!

title: Awesomeness
comment: Cannot believe it! (: Best mpd client, thank you, man!

title: Great app
comment: Great open source app, thanks dev.  Used to use on old phone, just set up with new.  For streaming, vorbis didn't work so had to change to lame in mpd.conf, otherwise just played for a sec and stopped. So if you have trouble streaming, try switching to lame in httpd settings.

title: great app
comment: Using this one to control MPD on my Raspberry Pi.. works really great. Maybe some layout update? keep up the great work :)

title: Awesome
comment: Works flawlessly for me.
This app + raspberrypi is really good Thanks
Very good

title: Very very nice
comment: Only problem I found....it can hardly handle big playlists. When I add a dir with a lot of music it crashes sometimes.   Streaming is very cool feature :)
You're the best

title: Awesome app
comment: Best MPD client so far for android. Bug: when u move the volume slider often it goes to next song instead...

comment: Allow http.buffer to be increased and this would receive a 5!

title: Nice
comment: Huge collection still fast

title: Good working remote for MPD
comment: Works great on my galaxy Tab accept for the covers which don't work on android 3.2. Therefore 4 Stars!

title: Great app!
comment: Does its job without complicated UI.
Can't get it working over 3G. Takes ages to buffer from my Wifi when streaming, but otherwise it's really good.

title: Awesome
comment: Controls mpd beautifully and streams great. An amazing app.

title: You can listen
comment: Works fine on Moto Atrix. And the audio is streamed to my phone via mpd httpd output mode, so i can hear it.

comment: I use this with my gentoo mpd set up for home music, works like a charm

title: Great app
comment: Did everything I expected it too.

title: Exactly what I wanted

title: Nice

title: great player
comment: Prefer MPDroid to Droid MPD client. This one works better with my setup. Can't find the source on github though.
Ogg streaming doesn´t work =(

title: Still great.
comment: Amazing app. mp3 streaming takes a little bit to buffer, but works great. OGG streaming didn't work last I tried, but that was a while ago. A widget would be nice. Lockscreen controls will pause/play, but will not change tracks. I'm not sure if the lockscreen controls are a part of the app or my ROM, though. Last I checked (and it has been a while), this was the ONLY mpd app that can handle MPD's built-in HTTP stream and password authentication. (Droid X; android 2.3; Liberty 3 ROM)

title: MPD is the only way!
comment: This app works great, could maybe use a slightly better library interface.

title: mail address
comment: Hi guys, you write on your issue page: write us because....so where i can find the mail address in the link to the developers website. Nice black with some french text. Mhh, sorry but that's not intenational. Please also an english text and the mail address, because i have have a lot to offer and some questions. Thanks..

title: good app, needs polishing
comment: I was impressed with MPDroid, but it has problems. Streaming is mediocre at best, and browse by album fails for similar album names. Otherwise great!

title: Works, but can be clunky
comment: Could use more options on the streaming. Should have on/off buttons for streaming rather than one that does both.

title: Just what I needed!
comment: Really slick looking and has good options like different settings for wlan etc. Althought I would like to set buffer cache size and playercontrol widg

title: Great app
comment: Best mpd app on the market. There's one small buy that annoys me, if you have multiple albums with the same name but by different artists, it shows tracks from both albums.

title: Nearly perfect
comment: ... but please add the ability to install to sd in the next version :)
Functional but why such a long delay to connect to server? Other android clients connect instantly.

title: Playlists
comment: Should be able to play a playlist directly instead of adding it to now playing.

title: Awesome
comment: All android apps shoul look and work like this one <3

title: Fantastic
comment: I wish more people knew about this product and mpd in general!
Will not play unless default ports used , otherwise a perfect mpd client.
Cannot connect to server unless wifi is active. Don't need to be connected to wifi, but won't connect over 3G unless the wifi chipset is turned on.

title: Buffer Control
comment: I just Setup MPD on my Linux server the other day and this was a Welcome surprise for my phone, the only request i have is that we could control/Increase the buffer size other then that PERFECTION!
Idk wat to do
Top notch, my family loves it! Note to devs: I like the old UI better than the beta one. It's simple and lightweight.
Excellent.
I have +12000 songs in my playlist. If there was a search option, this would easily get a 5 from me.
Works flawlessly on my droid x. Only thing missing is server output control however the wifi access settings are a GREAT Idea and work well.

title: Best mpd accessory!
comment: Works well on my Nexus. Best mpd client/controller on Android
Good client, could do with being able to adjust media volume, woulda given it 5 stars if you could
Works brilliantly on my epic. who needs a squeezeboz anymore

title: Almost perfect
comment: It streams music nicely, but I can't find any button for closing the application when I don't need it anymore.
Constantly "connecting" makes it almost unusable. Play controls and playlists could be more accessible. Settled for bitmpc in the end
Works well, better than 'Droid MPD Client' in terms of UI and navigating library and managing playlists. Only complaint: volume control is hard to use
I did everything to the book. Got music to stream to device but no sound Came from the device.
Great client! Any chance to see a widget?
4 stars only because it doesn't handle large (30k) playlists. Otherwise great app!
Very nice app, but it would be nice with a search function both in library and playlist.
Perfect. Does all what a good mpd client should do.
Pretty Good! Sometimes has problems reconnecting, and a dirct button to the playlist would be nice. And I'd love album arts in the album section.
I miss the ability to turn off album pics.
Prefer over bitmpc, if you are trying to decide.
Great, much better than the other mpd apps I've tried.
Awesome app. the only thing lacking is ogg streaming support
Excellent.
I have been using mpd on my linux machine for years. This mpd app is everything I could have wanted and more. Well done!
Great for folder organized collections.
Great app, I use it every day.
Attempted to use it with HTC Hero 2.1. Could not connect to server. With hacked 2.2 mod it works fine. I'd recommend ogg support for streaming.
Works flawlessly. I love having volume control always available with player controls. Sony Ericsson x10.
Perfect. Could use some minor usability tweaks but it's the best around.
Excellent app! The only problem I have is getting it to play streams with a bitrate of less than 128kbits, which is annoying low-reception areas.
Cannot stop or kill the applet when it is not able to connect. It always stays in the notification bar.
Took me some time to get the settings right but now it works like a charm. :-)
Well done!
Streaming only works with mp3 even though android supports ogg. Ubuntu's mpd needs to be recompiled with mp3 (lame) support
Must have
Doesn't let you specify arbitrary shoutcast url for streaming... kinda limited. Nice mpd client nonetheless.
looks good, but it crashes the server way too often, especially upon updating a playlist. Looses connection often too. Update needed.
Needs fixing a few small bugs but for the rest: it's great!
I've tried most mpd remotes in the market, and this is my favourite.
Works, fully featured but gives up way too easily - constant "connection error" messages. (Milestone 2.1)
Very happy! Thank you so much for making a app for us nerds! BTW I don't think anyone would have a problem if you put some ads on it
Very nice mpd client that can even do streaming. However, once the stream is started i don't see how to stop it. 5 stars when this is fixed.
Battery issues seem to be fixed on latest update. Grwat
Works good, easy to setup and streaming works although the app can become pretty slow while doing it.
Requires mpd server. Great! I control music on my computer at home and stream music to myself over 3G!
New version is so much faster. Works over 3g now. Great app
Better than pmix. Adds some nice features.
Great app, I used to use stream furious and a ssh session to do this. This is so much nicer. Keep up the good work.
Best mpd client for the android. LOVE the now playing screen. Wish it had a full screen widget though.
